    • Method Detail

      • enableDebug

        public void enableDebug()
        Description copied from interface: Interception
        Enables debug mode.

        With debug option on, you will see such parameters as device id, mouse coordinates, key code and all states.

        Note: Modifications goes before debug info output.

        Specified by:
        enableDebug in interface Interception

      • disableDebug

        public void disableDebug()
        Description copied from interface: Interception
        Disables debug mode.

        With debug option off, you will not see any additional information.

        Specified by:
        disableDebug in interface Interception

      • setInputSleep

        public void setInputSleep(int val)
        Description copied from interface: Interception
        Sets sleep between keyDown and keyUp.

        This parameter affects only text input functions like Interception.writeChar(Character) or Interception.writeText(String).

        Specified by:
        setInputSleep in interface Interception
        Parameters:
        val - must be more that zero, in other keys the order of key input is unpredictable.
        See Also:
        Interception.writeChar(Character), Interception.writeText(String)

      • unload

        public void unload()
        Description copied from interface: Interception
        Unloads library.

        Finishes all processes and stops library.

        Specified by:
        unload in interface Interception

      • load

        public void load()
        Description copied from interface: Interception
        Loads library.

        Must be called before library use.

        Specified by:
        load in interface Interception

      • resetMouseModifier

        public void resetMouseModifier(Consumer<MouseStroke> modifier)
        Description copied from interface: Interception
        Sets mouse modifier.

        Before mouse event will be sent it will be modified with modifier.

        Specified by:
        resetMouseModifier in interface Interception
        Parameters:
        modifier - Modifier for mouse stroke.
        See Also:
        MouseStroke

        See Also:
        KeyStroke

      • resetOtherModifier

        public void resetOtherModifier(Consumer<UnknownStroke> modifier)
        Description copied from interface: Interception
        Sets modifier for unknown devices.

        Before any unknown device event will be sent it will be modified with modifier.

        Specified by:
        resetOtherModifier in interface Interception
        Parameters:
        modifier - Modifier for unknown device.
        See Also:
        UnknownStroke

      • setMouseId

        public int setMouseId()
        Description copied from interface: Interception
        Sets mouse id by receiving a mouse stroke.

        Waits for a key stroke. If stroke received from mouse device sets mouse id.

        Specified by:
        setMouseId in interface Interception
        Returns:
        MouseId if set was successful and -1 in other case.

      • setKeyboardId

        public int setKeyboardId()
        Description copied from interface: Interception
        Sets keyboard id by receiving a key stroke.

        Waits for a key stroke. If stroke received from keyboard device sets keyboard id.

        Specified by:
        setKeyboardId in interface Interception
        Returns:
        KeyboardId if set was successful and -1 in other case.

      • pressKey

        public void pressKey(char key)
        Description copied from interface: Interception
        Sets key button to pressed state.

        Note: Be careful with this function because chars like 'a'-'z', '\', '+' etc. are not related to keys. Use instead Keys

        Specified by:
        pressKey in interface Interception
        Parameters:
        key - Keyboard key id.
        See Also:
        Keys

      • releaseKey

        Note: Be careful with this function because chars like 'a'-'z', '\', '+' etc. are not related to keys. Use instead Keys

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        key - Keyboard key id.
        See Also:
        Keys

      • moveMouseOn

        public void moveMouseOn(int x,
                        int y)
        Description copied from interface: Interception
        Move mouse on x, y coordinates.

        Note: Before using this function be sure that you turned off mouse acceleration. In other case behavior is unpredictable.

        Specified by:
        moveMouseOn in interface Interception
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate to move on.
        y - Y coordinate to move on.

      • moveMouseTo

        Note: Before using this function be sure that you turned off mouse acceleration. In other case behavior is unpredictable.

        Specified by:
        moveMouseTo in interface Interception
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate to move to.
        y - Y coordinate to move to.

        Parameters:
